column4: guys, does anyone know if the Majic SysRq key is enabled on ubuntu by default? doesn't seem to be working on my end
it is set to y in the generic kernel config (and I know alt-sysrq-k works at least)
what's k do in this case? Is there an easy way for me to test without trying to reboot mymachine?
kills all processes on the current virtual console
including X sessions I see. Lol...it worked. thanks ;)
check System Settings/Keyboard/Shortcuts/System, it is disabled by default on non-unity sessions
it's not there. I'm in Unity (3d). what command should I map to restore it?
or is there a way to restore the defaults?
there is, unity --reset; which may help if your settings are messed up
I tried that, but to no avail
what it is configured to in ccsm/Unity/Key to execute a command?
<alt>F2
alt by itself pulls up the HUD, so I know the key is woriking
maybe something is conflicting with it? try changing it to something else and seeing if it comes up
odd...remapping it did indeed work. wonder how I'd go about tracking down the conflict?
not really sure, you could search ccsm in the advanced search section for f2 (checking the search in setting values box), but ccsm will usually warn on duplicate settings
ok, thanks for the help
otherwise, you may have installed something which grabs the keys before compiz gets them, but I'm not sure what that would be
I'm not really sure what you are asking, which popup? in ccsm? or the System Settings/Keyboard applet?
oh you mean the listing of shortcuts that pop up when you hold super
not sure, it doesn't appear on my netbook (I guess the screen is too small), I'll check my desktop
